p: Feed samples (meadow hay, concentrate, concentrate + Zn and Hmix) were analyzed in triplicate for dry matter (No. 967.03), nitrogen (No. 968.06), crude protein (No. 990.03), ash (No. 942.05), fat (No. 983.23), acid-detergent fiber and neutral-detergent fiber contents according to standard procedures [ 24, 25], as previously described [ 22]. The bioactive compounds of the Hmix presented in Table 1 were analyzed by ultra-high-resolution mass spectrometry using a Dionex UltiMate 3000RS system (Thermo Scientific, Darmstadt, Germany) with a charged aerosol detector connected to a high-resolution quadrupole time-of-flight mass spectrometer (HR/Q-TOF/MS, Impact II, Bruker Daltonic GmbH, Bremen, Germany) [ 22].
